result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Mitchell T Picord in court, in custody, with attorney Eric R. Hart.   Brian J. Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The charges are dismissed and read into 15CF1093.
Plea hearing on May 23, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Mitchell T Picord in court, in custody, with attorney Eric R. Hart.   Michael Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Hart advises the Court the Defendant is still on the DTC wait list and requests a date towards the end of May.  The Court schedules the matter for a plea in late May.  Plea hearing scheduled for May 23, 2016 at 10:00 am.
Hearing on April 11, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Mitchell T Picord in court, in custody, with attorney Eric R. Hart.   Stephen Joseph Centinario appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defendant was accepted and on the wait list for treatment court.  There are about 15 people on the wait list.  Hearing scheduled for April 11, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Wisconsin Community Service non-compliance letter received and filed.
Hearing at 03-17-2016 08:30 am

Defendant Mitchell T Picord in court, in custody, with attorney Eric R. Hart.   Stephen Joseph Centinario appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Hart requests an adjournment of the trial and advises the Court the Defendant has applied to Drug Treatment Court.  The Defendant is currently on a probation hold on a Milwaukee County case. Attorney Hart requests a date be set in 30 days to review status of application.  The Defendant is sworn in by the clerk and the Defendant waives his right to a jury trial.  The Court sets the matter out 30 days to check on status of treatment court.  Hearing scheduled for March 17, 2016 at 08:30 am.
for substition of counsel.  Attorney Eric Hart is now attorney of record.
Filed by the State. Witness list attached.
Hearing at 02-18-2016 09:30 am
to file amended criminal complaint.

Defendant Mitchell T Picord in court, in custody, with attorney Nicole M Masnica.   Kevin Michael Osborne appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Masnica has received discovery and an offer.   The State files a motion to amend the criminal compliant.  Attorney Masnica does not object to the court accepting the amended complaint. The Defendant has new charges pending and is being considered for Drug Treatment Court.  Hearing scheduled for February 18, 2016 at 09:30 am.
Hearing at 01-11-2016 09:30 am
Defendant waives his/her right to a Preliminary Hearing.

Defendant Mitchell T Picord in court, in custody, with attorney Nicole M Masnica.   Bryan C. Bayer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Bail remains as fixed.  Hearing scheduled for January 11, 2016 at 09:30 am.
Preliminary hearing at 12-03-2015 10:00 am
Attorney Nicole Masnica appointed as counsel for defendant 10/23/15.
Preliminary hearing at 12-03-2015 10:00 am
